data.scheme_name: Capital Investment subsidy scheme for construction/expansion/ modernization of cold storage and storages for Horticulture Produce - Except NER & Hill States - New
data.benefits: Scheme provides Capital Invesment Subsidy @ 35% of the capital cost of projects.
data.eligibility:
Eligibility for Assistance:
New Cold Storage: Multi-chamber units with energy-efficient technologies (thermal insulation, humidity control, advanced cooling, automation) meeting Ministry-approved standards.
Controlled Atmosphere (CA) Stores: Limited to temperate fruit crops in production areas with NHB-approved protocols.
data.conditions:
All cold storage units must meet NCCD and NHB technical standards to qualify for subsidy.
Minimum storage capacity above 5000 MT up to 10000 MT.
data.beneficiaries:
Infrastructure/Activity and Crops eligible:
a. Assistance for setting up of new Cold Storage infrastructure will be available only to Multi-Chamber cold Storage units with technologies which are energy efficient with provision of thermal insulation, humidity controlled, advance cooling systems, automation, etc, having specification and standards approved by the Ministry. 
b. In case of CA Stores, projects of temperate fruit crops located in production areas for which to NHB protocols are available, are only are allowed.
data.prerequisites:
All cold storage units must meet NCCD and NHB technical standards to qualify for subsidy.
Minimum storage capacity above 5000 MT up to 10000 MT.
data.context: National Horticulture Board of the Ministry of Agriculture launched a Capital Investment subsidy scheme for construction/expansion/ modernization of cold storage and storages for Horticulture Products for reducing post-harvest losses and to promote setting up of cold storages in the country.
data.objective: To promote setting up cold storages in the country for reducing post-harvest losses.
data.description:
Scheme provides Capital Invesment Subsidy @ 35% of the capital cost of projects.
Additional subsidy:- Maximum permissible subsidy shall be subject to original invoices and in no case more than Rs. 7.50 crore, whichever is lower. For add-on technology, subsidy shall be provided as credit linked back ended at 35% of the capital cost.
data.how_to_apply: Project involving term loan may be submitted to Banks/Financial Institutions/National Cooperative Development Corporation as the case may be for appraisal/sanction of loan and release of National Horticulture Board subsidy. For self-financed projects, a Letter of Intent is needed.
data.funding_mechanism: Amount shall be disbursed in the bank account of the eligible applicant undertaking the project.
data.additional_info:
Cost Norms:-
Type 1 Cold Storage (Large chamber, single temperature): ₹8000/MT (up to 5000 MT), ₹7600/MT (5001-6500 MT), ₹7200/MT (6501-8000 MT), ₹6800/MT (8001-10000 MT).
Type 2 Cold Storage (PEB, multi-temperature, <250 MT chambers): ₹10,000/MT (up to 5000 MT), ₹9500/MT (5001-6500 MT), ₹9000/MT (6501-8000 MT), ₹8500/MT (8001-10000 MT).
Type 2 with CA Technology: Additional ₹10,000/MT for CA technology; only for NHB-compliant crops.
Modernization: ₹5000/MT (5001-10000 MT) for upgrades like PLCs, graders, refrigeration, etc.
Admissible Costs for Add-On Technology for Controlled Atmosphere (CA):-
CA Generator: ₹1.25 crore per unit (max 2 generators).
Specialized CA Doors: ₹2.5 lakh per door (max 20 doors).
CA Tents: As per invoice (max 5 enclosures).
Programmed Logic Controller (PLC): 50% of cost (max ₹10 lakh).
Dock Levelers: ₹7 lakh per unit (max 5 units).
data.checklist_info_a:
1. Establishment proof of the entity 
2. Copy of completion certificate of the project from the Bank 
3. A financial appraisal from the Bank before sanctioning of term loan along with any other details showing investment components and their costs 
4. Presanction inspection of the project. 
5. Term loan sanction letter provided by the Bank  
6. Term loan disbursement detail for the project 
7. Term loan account details of the promoter 
8. Copy of Record of Rights (ROR) of project land as mentioned in the loan document by the beneficiary along with Search Report 
9. Copy of record of right (ROR) furnished by the beneficiary to NHB along with the application for Letter of Intent (LOI) 
10. Copy of Photographs captured at the time of the inspection of the project duly signed by the Bank Officer and the promoter 
11. Duly certified expenditure statement on the basis of bills or vouchers by Bank or CA certificate as per NHB format 
12. Others KYC Documents
